H0.text: Brushing the pet daily to remove bacteria is a way a pet owner can prevent bacteria from animal wastes that make organisms sick from polluting water supplies during storms.

H1.text: Feeding pets food that produces less waste is a way a pet owner can prevent bacteria from animal wastes from polluting water supplies during storms.

H2.text: Bag the pet waste and throw it in the trash is a way a pet owner can prevent bacteria that make organisms sick from animal waste from polluting water supplies that are washed into them by storms.

H3.text: Wash the pet with shampoo to kill the bacteria is a method a pet owner might use to prevent bacteria from animal wastes—bacteria that can make organisms sick and are often washed into water supplies by storms—from polluting the water supplies.

A4.text: feces disposed of into a river or sea

A5.text: consuming or touching it may result in sickness or infection
